verses.verse: Then it happened<WH1961> in the spring,<WH8666> at the time<WH6256> when kings<WH4428> go<WH3318> out [to battle,] that Joab<WH3097> led<WH5090> out the army<WH6635> <WH2428> and ravaged<WH7843> the land<WH776> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon,<WH5983> and came<WH935> and besieged<WH6696> Rabbah.<WH7237> But David<WH1732> stayed<WH3427> at Jerusalem.<WH3389> And Joab<WH3097> struck<WH5221> Rabbah<WH7237> and overthrew<WH2040> it.

And David<WH1732> took<WH3947> the crown<WH5850> of their king<WH4428> from his head,<WH7218> and he found<WH4672> it to weigh<WH4948> a talent<WH3603> of gold,<WH2091> and there was a precious<WH3368> stone<WH68> in it; and it was placed<WH1961> on David's head.<WH7218> And he brought<WH3318> out the spoil<WH7998> of the city,<WH5892> a very<WH3966> great<WH7235> amount.

And he brought<WH3318> out the people<WH5971> who<WH834> [were] in it, and cut<WH7787> [them] with saws<WH4050> and with sharp<WH2757> instruments<WH2757> and with axes.<WH4050> And thus<WH3651> David<WH1732> did<WH6213> to all<WH3605> the cities<WH5892> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon.<WH5983> Then David<WH1732> and all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> returned<WH7725> [to] Jerusalem.<WH3389>

Now it came<WH1961> about after<WH310> this,<WH3651> that war<WH4421> broke<WH5975> out at Gezer<WH1507> with the Philistines;<WH6430> then<WH227> Sibbecai<WH5444> the Hushathite<WH2843> killed<WH5221> Sippai,<WH5598> one of the descendants<WH3211> of the giants,<WH9571> and they were subdued.<WH3665>

And there was war<WH4421> with the Philistines<WH6430> again,<WH5750> and Elhanan<WH445> the son<WH1121> of Jair<WH3265> killed<WH5221> Lahmi<WH3902> the brother<WH251> of Goliath<WH1555> the Gittite,<WH1663> the shaft<WH6086> of whose spear<WH2595> [was] like a weaver's beam.<WH4500>

And again<WH5750> there was war<WH4421> at Gath,<WH1661> where there was a man<WH376> of [great] stature<WH4060> who had twenty-four fingers<WH676> and toes,<WH676> six<WH8337> [fingers on each hand] and six<WH8337> [toes on each foot;] and he also<WH1571> was descended<WH3205> from the giants.<WH9571>
And when he taunted<WH2778> Israel,<WH3478> Jonathan<WH3083> the son<WH1121> of Shimea,<WH8092> David's brother,<WH251> killed<WH5221> him.
These<WH411> were descended<WH3205> from the giants<WH9571> in Gath,<WH1661> and they fell<WH5307> by the hand<WH3027> of David<WH1732> and by the hand<WH3027> of his servants.<WH5650>
